actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Intelligence (Permanent).
Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for the personal safety of persons engaged in furthering the foreign intelligence operations of the United States.

summary.text: Amends the Federal criminal code to establish penalties for anyone having authorized possession of information identifying an individual as associated with a U. S. agency engaged in foreign intelligence operations, who discloses such information to anyone not authorized to receive it. Establishes criminal penalties for anyone who willfully communicates to any person or makes public information identifying an individual as engaged in furthering foreign intelligence operations on behalf of the United States, with intent to disclose a relationship of such individual with such operations, knowing that the disclosure may prejudice such individual's safety.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for the personal safety of persons engaged in furthering the foreign intelligence operations of the United States.
